themes: Lack of standard checks and balances in Austin's programs
Concerns about rapid city growth and inadequate adaptation
Critique of funding for for-profit organizations
Preference for adopting best practices from other cities
key_phrases: reinstate some of the standard checks and balances
leverage the best practices of what has been done elsewhere
short-sighted, extremely flawed programs that hurt more than help
reinstate the requirement of fiscal sponsorship for those that are not 501(c)3 orgs
siphoning tax dollars out of the community into the hands of orgs that are designed to make profits
legitimate training for adjudication of grant applications
individuals passing judgements on grant applications with NO working knowledge of the industry
barriers_identified: for-profit organizations competing with nonprofits for funding
lack of fiscal sponsorship requirement for non-501(c)3 organizations
solutions_proposed: adopt best practices from other cities
reinstate requirement of fiscal sponsorship for non-501(c)3 organizations
provide legitimate training for adjudication of grant applications
